00046 /* GCFGR bit field definition                                                                               */
00047 #define CKCU_POS_CKOUTSRC       0
00048 #define CKCU_MASK_CKOUTSRC      ((u32)0x7 << CKCU_POS_CKOUTSRC)
00049 
00050 #define CKCU_POS_PLLSRC         8
00051 #define CKCU_MASK_PLLSRC        ((u32)0x1 << CKCU_POS_PLLSRC)
00052 
00053 #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_USB_PLL)
00054 #define CKCU_POS_USBPLLSRC      9
00055 #define CKCU_MASK_USBPLLSRC     ((u32)0x1 << CKCU_POS_USBPLLSRC)
00056 
00057 #define CKCU_POS_USBSRC         10
00058 #define CKCU_MASK_USBSRC        ((u32)0x1 << CKCU_POS_USBSRC)
00059 #endif
00060 
00061 #define CKCU_POS_CKREFPRE       11
00062 #define CKCU_MASK_CKREFPRE      ((u32)0x1F << CKCU_POS_CKREFPRE)
00063 
00064 /* GCCR bit field definition                                                                                */
00065 #define CKCU_POS_SW             0
00066 #define CKCU_MASK_SW            ((u32)0x7 << CKCU_POS_SW)
00067 
00068 #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_USB_PLL)
00069 #define CKCU_POS_USBPLLEN       3
00070 #define CKCU_MASK_USBPLLEN      ((u32)0x1 << CKCU_POS_USBPLLEN)
00071 #endif
00072 
00073 #define CKCU_POS_PLLEN          9
00074 #define CKCU_MASK_PLLEN         ((u32)0x1 << CKCU_POS_PLLEN)
00075 
00076 #define CKCU_POS_HSEEN          10
00077 #define CKCU_MASK_HSEEN         ((u32)0x1 << CKCU_POS_HSEEN)
00078 
00079 #define CKCU_POS_HSIEN          11
00080 #define CKCU_MASK_HSIEN         ((u32)0x1 << CKCU_POS_HSIEN)
00081 
00082 #define CKCU_POS_CKMEN          16
00083 #define CKCU_MASK_CKMEN         ((u32)0x1 << CKCU_POS_CKMEN)
00084 
00085 #define CKCU_POS_PSRCEN         17
00086 #define CKCU_MASK_PSRCEN        ((u32)0x1 << CKCU_POS_PSRCEN)
00087 
00088 /* PLLCFGR bit field definition                                                                             */
00089 #define CKCU_POS_POTD           21
00090 #define CKCU_MASK_POTD          ((u32)0x3 << CKCU_POS_POTD)
00091 
00092 #define CKCU_POS_PFBD           23
00093 #define CKCU_MASK_PFBD          ((u32)0x0F << CKCU_POS_PFBD)
00094 
00095 /* PLLCR bit field definition                                                                               */
00096 #define CKCU_POS_PLLBYPASS      31
00097 #define CKCU_MASK_PLLBYPASS     ((u32)0x1 << CKCU_POS_PLLBYPASS)
00098 
00099 /* APBCFGR bit field definition                                                                             */
00100 #define CKCU_POS_ADC0DIV        16
00101 #define CKCU_MASK_ADC0DIV       ((u32)0x7 << CKCU_POS_ADC0DIV)
00102 
00103 #if (LIBCFG_ADC1)
00104 #define CKCU_POS_ADC1DIV        20
00105 #define CKCU_MASK_ADC1DIV       ((u32)0x7 << CKCU_POS_ADC1DIV)
00106 #endif
00107 
00108 #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_LCD_SRC)
00109 #define CKCU_POS_LCDSRC         4
00110 #define CKCU_MASK_LCDSRC        ((u32)0x3 << CKCU_POS_LCDSRC)
00111 #endif
00112 
00113 #if (LIBCFG_LCD)
00114 #define CKCU_POS_LCDDIV         8
00115 #define CKCU_MASK_LCDDIV        ((u32)0x7 << CKCU_POS_LCDDIV)
00116 #endif
00117 
00118 #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_MCTM_SRC)
00119 #define CKCU_POS_MCTMCSEL       8
00120 #define CKCU_MASK_MCTMCSEL      ((u32)0x1 << CKCU_POS_MCTMCSEL)
00121 #endif
00122 
00123 #if (LIBCFG_MIDI)
00124 #define CKCU_POS_MIDIDIV        24
00125 #define CKCU_MASK_MIDIDIV       ((u32)0x7 << CKCU_POS_MIDIDIV)
00126 #endif
00127 
00128 /* CKST bit field definition                                                                                */
00129 #define CKCU_POS_PLLST          8
00130 #define CKCU_MASK_PLLST         ((u32)0xF << CKCU_POS_PLLST)
00131 
00132 #define CKCU_POS_HSEST          16
00133 #define CKCU_MASK_HSEST         ((u32)0x3 << CKCU_POS_HSEST)
00134 
00135 #define CKCU_POS_HSIST          24
00136 #define CKCU_MASK_HSIST         ((u32)0x7 << CKCU_POS_HSIST)
00137 
00138 #define CKCU_POS_CKSWST         0
00139 #define CKCU_MASK_CKSWST        ((u32)0x7 << CKCU_POS_CKSWST)
00140 
00141 /* LPCR bit field definition                                                                                */
00142 #define CKCU_POS_BKISO          0
00143 #define CKCU_MASK_BKISO         ((u32)0x1 << CKCU_POS_BKISO)
00144 
00145 /* HSICR bit field definition                                                                               */
00146 #define CKCU_POS_TRIMEN         (0)
00147 #define CKCU_MASK_TRIMEN        ((u32)0x1 << CKCU_POS_TRIMEN)
00148 
00149 #define CKCU_POS_ATCEN          (1)
00150 #define CKCU_MASK_ATCEN         ((u32)0x1 << CKCU_POS_ATCEN)
00151 
00152 #define CKCU_POS_REFCLKSEL      (5)
00153 #define CKCU_MASK_REFCLKSEL     ((u32)0x3 << CKCU_POS_REFCLKSEL)
00154

00156   * @}

00159 /* Private macro -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00160 /** @defgroup CKCU_Private_Macro CKCU private macros
00161   * @{
00162   */
00163 #define CKCU_BF_WRITE(Reg, Mask, Pos, WriteValue)   (Reg = ((Reg & ~((u32)Mask)) | ((u32)WriteValue << Pos)))
00164 #define CKCU_BF_READ(Reg, Mask, Pos)                ((Reg & (u32)Mask) >> Pos)
00165 /**
00166   * @}
00167   */
00168 
00169 /* Global functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00170 /** @addtogroup CKCU_Exported_Functions CKCU exported functions
00171   * @{
00172   */
00173 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00174  * @brief Deinitialize the CKCU registers to the reset values.
00175  * @retval None
00176  ************************************************************************************************************/
00177 void CKCU_DeInit(void)
00178 {
00179   /* Reset system clock                                                                                     */
00180   CKCU_HSICmd(ENABLE);
00181   while (CKCU_GetClockReadyStatus(CKCU_FLAG_HSIRDY) == RESET);
00182   CKCU_SysClockConfig(CKCU_SW_HSI);
00183 
00184   #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_USB_PLL)
00185   HT_CKCU->GCFGR = 0x00000302;                   /* Reset value of GCFGR                                    */
00186   #else
00187   HT_CKCU->GCFGR = 0x00000102;                   /* Reset value of GCFGR                                    */
00188   #endif
00189   HT_CKCU->GCCR = 0x00000803;                    /* Reset value of GCCR                                     */
00190   HT_CKCU->GCIR = 0x000000FF;                    /* Clear all interrupt flags                               */
00191 
00192   #if (!LIBCFG_NO_PLL)
00193   HT_CKCU->PLLCR = 0;                            /* Reset value of PLLCR                                    */
00194   #endif
00195   HT_CKCU->AHBCFGR = 0;                          /* Reset value of AHBCFGR                                  */
00196   HT_CKCU->AHBCCR = 0x00000065;                  /* Reset value of AHBCCR                                   */
00197   #if (!LIBCFG_NO_ADC)
00198   HT_CKCU->APBCFGR = 0x00010000;                 /* Reset value of APBCFGR                                  */
00199   #endif
00200   HT_CKCU->APBCCR0 = 0;                          /* Reset value of APBCCR0                                  */
00201   HT_CKCU->APBCCR1 = 0;                          /* Reset value of APBCCR1                                  */
00202   #if (!LIBCFG_CKCU_NO_APB_PRESCALER)
00203   HT_CKCU->APBPCSR0 = 0;                         /* Reset value of APBPCSR0                                 */
00204   HT_CKCU->APBPCSR1 = 0;                         /* Reset value of APBPCSR1                                 */
00205   #endif
00206   #if (!LIBCFG_CKCU_NO_AUTO_TRIM)
00207   HT_CKCU->HSICR = 0;                            /* Reset value of HSICR                                    */
00208   #endif
00209   #if ((!LIBCFG_CKCU_NO_APB_PRESCALER) && (LIBCFG_PWM0 || LIBCFG_PWM1 || LIBCFG_MIDI || LIBCFG_DAC0 || LIBCFG_DAC1 || LIBCFG_DACDUAL16 || LIBCFG_LCD || LIBCFG_LEDC || LIBCFG_TKEY))
00210   HT_CKCU->APBPCSR2 = 0;                         /* Reset value of APBPCSR2                                 */
00211   #endif
00212   #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_HSIRDYCR)
00213   HT_CKCU->HSIRDYCR = 0;                         /* Reset value of HSIRDYCR                                 */
00214   #endif
00215   #if (!LIBCFG_CKCU_NO_LPCR)
00216   HT_CKCU->LPCR = 0;                             /* Reset value of LPCR                                     */
00217   #endif
00218   HT_CKCU->MCUDBGCR = 0;                         /* Reset value of MCUDBGCR                                 */
00219 }
00220 
00221 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00222  * @brief Enable or Disable the external high speed oscillator (HSE).
00223  * @note  HSE can not be stopped if it is used by system clock or PLL.
00224  * @param Cmd: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00225  * @retval None
00226  ************************************************************************************************************/
00227 void CKCU_HSECmd(ControlStatus Cmd)
00228 {
00229   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00230   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(Cmd));
00231 
00232   CKCU_BF_WRITE(HT_CKCU->GCCR, CKCU_MASK_HSEEN, CKCU_POS_HSEEN, Cmd);
00233 }
00234 
00235 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00236  * @brief Enable or Disable the internal high speed oscillator (HSI).
00237  * @note  HSI can not be stopped if it is used by system clock or PLL.
00238  * @param Cmd: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00239  * @retval None
00240  ************************************************************************************************************/
00241 void CKCU_HSICmd(ControlStatus Cmd)
00242 {
00243   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00244   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(Cmd));
00245 
00246   CKCU_BF_WRITE(HT_CKCU->GCCR, CKCU_MASK_HSIEN, CKCU_POS_HSIEN, Cmd);
00247 }
00248 
00249 #if (!LIBCFG_NO_PLL)
00250 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00251  * @brief Enable or Disable the PLL clock.
00252  * @note  PLL can not be stopped if it is used by system clock or CK_REF.
00253  * @param Cmd: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00254  * @retval None
00255  ************************************************************************************************************/
00256 void CKCU_PLLCmd(ControlStatus Cmd)
00257 {
00258   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00259   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(Cmd));
00260 
00261   CKCU_BF_WRITE(HT_CKCU->GCCR, CKCU_MASK_PLLEN, CKCU_POS_PLLEN, Cmd);
00262 }
00263 #endif
00264

00267  * @brief Enable or Disable the USBPLL clock.
00268  * @param Cmd: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00269  * @retval None
00270  ************************************************************************************************************/
00271 void CKCU_USBPLLCmd(ControlStatus Cmd)
00272 {
00273   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00274   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(Cmd));
00275 
00276   CKCU_BF_WRITE(HT_CKCU->GCCR, CKCU_MASK_USBPLLEN, CKCU_POS_USBPLLEN, Cmd);
00277 }

00280 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00281  * @brief Wait for HSE is ready to be used.
00282  * @retval SUCCESS or ERROR
00283  ************************************************************************************************************/
00284 ErrStatus CKCU_WaitHSEReady(void)
00285 {
00286   u32 ReadyCnt = 0;
00287 
00288   /* Wait until HSE is ready or time-out occurred                                                           */
00289   while (CKCU_GetClockReadyStatus(CKCU_FLAG_HSERDY) != SET)
00290   {
00291     if (++ReadyCnt >= HSE_READY_TIME)
00292     {
00293       return ERROR;
00294     }
00295   }
00296 
00297   return SUCCESS;
00298 }
00299 
00300 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00301  * @brief Check whether the specific clock ready flag is set or not.
00302  * @param CKCU_FLAG: specify the clock ready flag.
00303  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00304  *     @arg CKCU_FLAG_USBPLLRDY : USB PLL ready flag
00305  *     @arg CKCU_FLAG_PLLRDY    : PLL ready flag
00306  *     @arg CKCU_FLAG_HSERDY    : HSE ready flag
00307  *     @arg CKCU_FLAG_HSIRDY    : HSI ready flag
00308  *     @arg CKCU_FLAG_LSERDY    : LSE ready flag
00309  *     @arg CKCU_FLAG_LSIRDY    : LSI ready flag
00310  * @retval SET or RESET
00311  ************************************************************************************************************/
00312 FlagStatus CKCU_GetClockReadyStatus(u32 CKCU_FLAG)
00313 {
00314   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00315   Assert_Param(IS_CKCU_FLAG(CKCU_FLAG));
00316 
00317   if (HT_CKCU->GCSR & CKCU_FLAG)
00318   {
00319     return SET;
00320   }
00321   else
00322   {
00323     return RESET;
00324   }
00325 }
00326 
00327 #if (!LIBCFG_NO_PLL)
00328 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00329  * @brief This function is used to configure PLL.
00330  * @param PLL_InitStruct: pointer to CKCU_PLLInitTypeDef structure.
00331  * @retval None
00332  ************************************************************************************************************/
00333 void CKCU_PLLInit(CKCU_PLLInitTypeDef *PLL_InitStruct)
00334 {
00335   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00336   Assert_Param(IS_PLL_CLKSRC(PLL_InitStruct->ClockSource));
00337   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(PLL_InitStruct->BYPASSCmd));
00338   Assert_Param(IS_PLL_CFG(PLL_InitStruct->CFG));
00339 
00340   CKCU_BF_WRITE(HT_CKCU->GCFGR, CKCU_MASK_PLLSRC, CKCU_POS_PLLSRC, PLL_InitStruct->ClockSource);
00341   CKCU_BF_WRITE(HT_CKCU->PLLCR, CKCU_MASK_PLLBYPASS, CKCU_POS_PLLBYPASS, PLL_InitStruct->BYPASSCmd);
00342   HT_CKCU->PLLCFGR = (HT_CKCU->PLLCFGR & 0x0000FFFF) | PLL_InitStruct->CFG;
00343 }
00344 #endif
00345 
00346 #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_USB_PLL)
00347 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00348  * @brief This function is used to configure USBPLL.
00349  * @param USBPLL_InitStruct: pointer to CKCU_PLLInitTypeDef structure.
00350  * @retval None
00351  ************************************************************************************************************/
00352 void CKCU_USBPLLInit(CKCU_PLLInitTypeDef *USBPLL_InitStruct)
00353 {
00354   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00355   Assert_Param(IS_PLL_CLKSRC(USBPLL_InitStruct->ClockSource));
00356   Assert_Param(IS_USBPLL_CFG(USBPLL_InitStruct->CFG));
00357 
00358   CKCU_BF_WRITE(HT_CKCU->GCFGR, CKCU_MASK_USBPLLSRC, CKCU_POS_USBPLLSRC, USBPLL_InitStruct->ClockSource);
00359   HT_CKCU->PLLCFGR = (HT_CKCU->PLLCFGR & 0xFFFF0000) | USBPLL_InitStruct->CFG;
00360 }
00361 
00362 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00363  * @brief Configure the CK_USB clock source.
00364  * @param USBSRC: specify the USB clock source.
00365  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00366  *     @arg CKCU_CKPLL    : CK_USB = CK_PLL
00367  *     @arg CKCU_CKUSBPLL : CK_USB = CK_USBPLL
00368  * @retval None
00369  ************************************************************************************************************/
00370 void CKCU_USBClockConfig(CKCU_USBSRC_TypeDef USBSRC)
00371 {
00372   CKCU_BF_WRITE(HT_CKCU->GCFGR, CKCU_MASK_USBSRC, CKCU_POS_USBSRC, USBSRC);
00373 }
00374 #endif

00381  *     @arg CKCU_LCDSRC_LSI :
00382  *     @arg CKCU_LCDSRC_LSE :
00383  *     @arg CKCU_LCDSRC_HSI :
00384  *     @arg CKCU_LCDSRC_HSE :
00385  * @retval None

00387 void CKCU_LCDClockConfig(CKCU_LCDSRC_TypeDef LCDSRC)

00394 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00395  * @brief Configure the MCTM clock source.
00396  * @param CKCU_MCTMSRC_x: specify the MCTM clock source.
00397  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00398  *     @arg CKCU_MCTMSRC_AHB    : CK_MCTM = CK_AHB
00399  *     @arg CKCU_MCTMSRC_USBPLL : CK_MCTM = CK_USBPLL
00400  * @retval None
00401  ************************************************************************************************************/
00402 void CKCU_MCTMClockConfig(CKCU_MCTMSRC_TypeDef CKCU_MCTMSRC_x)
00403 {
00404   Assert_Param(IS_MCTM_SRC(CKCU_MCTMSRC_x));
00405   CKCU_BF_WRITE(HT_CKCU->APBCFGR, CKCU_MASK_MCTMCSEL, CKCU_POS_MCTMCSEL, CKCU_MCTMSRC_x);
00406 }
00407 #endif
00408 
00409 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00410  * @brief Configure the CK_SYS source.
00411  * @param CLKSRC: specify the system clock source.
00412  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00413  *     @arg CKCU_SW_PLL : PLL is selected as CK_SYS
00414  *     @arg CKCU_SW_HSE : HSE is selected as CK_SYS
00415  *     @arg CKCU_SW_HSI : HSI is selected as CK_SYS
00416  *     @arg CKCU_SW_LSE : LSE is selected as CK_SYS
00417  *     @arg CKCU_SW_LSI : LSI is selected as CK_SYS
00418  * @retval None
00419  ************************************************************************************************************/
00420 ErrStatus CKCU_SysClockConfig(CKCU_SW_TypeDef CLKSRC)
00421 {
00422   u32 cnt = 0xFF;
00423 
00424   CKCU_BF_WRITE(HT_CKCU->GCCR, CKCU_MASK_SW, CKCU_POS_SW, CLKSRC);
00425 
00426   /* Wait until new system clock source is applied or time-out                                              */
00427   while (--cnt)
00428   {
00429     if (CKCU_GetSysClockSource() == (u32)CLKSRC)
00430     {
00431       return SUCCESS;
00432     }
00433   }
00434 
00435   return ERROR;
00436 }
00437 
00438 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00439  * @brief Return the source clock which is used as system clock.
00440  * @retval The source clock used as system clock.
00441  *         0x01: PLL is selected as system clock
00442  *         0x02: HSE is selected as system clock
00443  *         0x03: HSI is selected as system clock
00444  *         0x06: LSE is selected as system clock
00445  *         0x07: LSI is selected as system clock
00446  ************************************************************************************************************/
00447 u32 CKCU_GetSysClockSource(void)
00448 {
00449   return ((u32)CKCU_BF_READ(HT_CKCU->CKST, CKCU_MASK_CKSWST, CKCU_POS_CKSWST));
00450 }
00451 
00452 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00453  * @brief Configure the CK_AHB prescaler.
00454  * @param HCLKPRE: specify the value of divider.
00455  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00456  *     @arg CKCU_SYSCLK_DIV1  : HCLK = CK_SYS
00457  *     @arg CKCU_SYSCLK_DIV2  : HCLK = CK_SYS / 2
00458  *     @arg CKCU_SYSCLK_DIV4  : HCLK = CK_SYS / 4
00459  *     @arg CKCU_SYSCLK_DIV8  : HCLK = CK_SYS / 8
00460  *     @arg CKCU_SYSCLK_DIV16 : HCLK = CK_SYS / 16
00461  *     @arg CKCU_SYSCLK_DIV32 : HCLK = CK_SYS / 32
00462  * @retval None
00463  ************************************************************************************************************/
00464 void CKCU_SetHCLKPrescaler(CKCU_SYSCLKDIV_TypeDef HCLKPRE)
00465 {
00466   HT_CKCU->AHBCFGR = HCLKPRE;
00467 }
00468 
00469 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00470  * @brief Configure the CK_REF prescaler.
00471  * @param CKREFPRE: specify the value of divider.
00472  *   This parameter can be: CKCU_CKREFPRE_DIV2 to CKCU_CKREFPRE_DIV64 (CK_REF = CK_PLL / (2 * (N + 1)), N = 0 ~ 31)
00473  * @retval None
00474  ************************************************************************************************************/
00475 void CKCU_SetCKREFPrescaler(CKCU_CKREFPRE_TypeDef CKREFPRE)
00476 {
00477   CKCU_BF_WRITE(HT_CKCU->GCFGR, CKCU_MASK_CKREFPRE, CKCU_POS_CKREFPRE, CKREFPRE);
00478 }
00479 
00480 #if (!LIBCFG_NO_ADC)
00481 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00482  * @brief Configure the CK_ADCn prescaler.
00483  * @param CKCU_ADCPRE_ADCn: specify the ADCn.
00484  * @param CKCU_ADCPRE_DIVn: specify the prescaler value.
00485  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00486  *     @arg CKCU_ADCPRE_DIV1  : CK_ADC = HCLK / 1
00487  *     @arg CKCU_ADCPRE_DIV2  : CK_ADC = HCLK / 2
00488  *     @arg CKCU_ADCPRE_DIV3  : CK_ADC = HCLK / 3
00489  *     @arg CKCU_ADCPRE_DIV4  : CK_ADC = HCLK / 4
00490  *     @arg CKCU_ADCPRE_DIV8  : CK_ADC = HCLK / 8
00491  *     @arg CKCU_ADCPRE_DIV16 : CK_ADC = HCLK / 16
00492  *     @arg CKCU_ADCPRE_DIV32 : CK_ADC = HCLK / 32
00493  *     @arg CKCU_ADCPRE_DIV64 : CK_ADC = HCLK / 64
00494  * @retval None
00495  ************************************************************************************************************/
00496 void CKCU_SetADCnPrescaler(CKCU_ADCPRE_ADCn_TypeDef CKCU_ADCPRE_ADCn, CKCU_ADCPRE_TypeDef CKCU_ADCPRE_DIVn)
00497 {
00498   HT_CKCU->APBCFGR = (HT_CKCU->APBCFGR & (~(0x07 << CKCU_ADCPRE_ADCn))) | (CKCU_ADCPRE_DIVn << CKCU_ADCPRE_ADCn);
00499 }
00500 #endif
00501 
00502 #if (LIBCFG_LCD)
00503 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00504  * @brief Configure LCD clock prescaler.
00505  * @param LCDCPS: Specify LCD clock prescaler.
00506  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00507  *     @arg CKCU_LCDPRE_DIV1  :
00508  *     @arg CKCU_LCDPRE_DIV2  :
00509  *     @arg CKCU_LCDPRE_DIV4  :
00510  *     @arg CKCU_LCDPRE_DIV8  :
00511  *     @arg CKCU_LCDPRE_DIV16 :
00512  * @retval None
00513  ************************************************************************************************************/
00514 void CKCU_SetLCDPrescaler(CKCU_LCDPRE_TypeDef LCDPRE)
00515 {
00516   CKCU_BF_WRITE(HT_CKCU->APBCFGR, CKCU_MASK_LCDDIV, CKCU_POS_LCDDIV, LCDPRE);
00517 }
00518 #endif
00519 
00520 #if (LIBCFG_MIDI)
00521 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00522  * @brief Configure the CK_MIDI prescaler.
00523  * @param MIDIPRE: specify the value of divider.
00524  *        This parameter can be:
00525  *        @arg CKCU_MIDIPRE_DIV8  : CK_MIDI = HCLK / 8
00526  *        @arg CKCU_MIDIPRE_DIV9  : CK_MIDI = HCLK / 9
00527  *        @arg CKCU_MIDIPRE_DIV11 : CK_MIDI = HCLK / 11
00528  *        @arg CKCU_MIDIPRE_DIV13 : CK_MIDI = HCLK / 13
00529  *        @arg CKCU_MIDIPRE_DIV16 : CK_MIDI = HCLK / 16
00530  * @retval None
00531  ************************************************************************************************************/
00532 void CKCU_SetMIDIPrescaler(CKCU_MIDIPRE_TypeDef MIDIPRE)
00533 {
00534   CKCU_BF_WRITE(HT_CKCU->APBCFGR, CKCU_MASK_MIDIDIV, CKCU_POS_MIDIDIV, MIDIPRE);
00535 }
00536 #endif
00537 
00538 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00539  * @brief Return the frequency of the different clocks.
00540  * @param CKCU_Clk: pointer to CKCU_ClocksTypeDef structure to get the clocks frequency.
00541  * @retval None
00542  ************************************************************************************************************/
00543 void CKCU_GetClocksFrequency(CKCU_ClocksTypeDef* CKCU_Clk)
00544 {
00545   u32 div;
00546   u32 SystemCoreClockSrc = (HT_CKCU->CKST) & 7UL;
00547 #if (!LIBCFG_NO_PLL)
00548   CKCU_Clk->PLL_Freq = CKCU_GetPLLFrequency();
00549 #endif
00550   /* Get system frequency                                                                                   */
00551   switch (SystemCoreClockSrc)
00552   {
00553 #if (!LIBCFG_NO_PLL)
00554     case CKCU_SW_PLL:
00555       CKCU_Clk->SYSCK_Freq = CKCU_Clk->PLL_Freq;
00556       break;
00557 #endif
00558     case CKCU_SW_HSE:
00559       CKCU_Clk->SYSCK_Freq = HSE_VALUE;
00560       break;
00561     case CKCU_SW_HSI:
00562       CKCU_Clk->SYSCK_Freq = HSI_VALUE;
00563       break;
00564     #if (LIBCFG_LSE)
00565     case CKCU_SW_LSE:
00566       CKCU_Clk->SYSCK_Freq = LSE_VALUE;
00567       break;
00568     #endif
00569     case CKCU_SW_LSI:
00570       CKCU_Clk->SYSCK_Freq = LSI_VALUE;
00571       break;
00572     default:
00573       CKCU_Clk->SYSCK_Freq = 0;
00574       break;
00575   }
00576 
00577   /* Get HCLK frequency                                                                                     */
00578   div = HT_CKCU->AHBCFGR;
00579   CKCU_Clk->HCLK_Freq = (div >= 5) ? ((CKCU_Clk->SYSCK_Freq) >> 5) : ((CKCU_Clk->SYSCK_Freq) >> div);
00580 
00581   /* Get ADC frequency                                                                                      */
00582   #if (LIBCFG_NO_ADC)
00583   #else
00584   #if (HT32_LIB_ENABLE_GET_CK_ADC)
00585   div = CKCU_BF_READ(HT_CKCU->APBCFGR, CKCU_MASK_ADC0DIV, CKCU_POS_ADC0DIV);
00586   CKCU_Clk->ADC0_Freq = (div == 7) ? ((CKCU_Clk->HCLK_Freq) / 3) : ((CKCU_Clk->HCLK_Freq) >> div);
00587   #if (LIBCFG_ADC1)
00588   div = CKCU_BF_READ(HT_CKCU->APBCFGR, CKCU_MASK_ADC1DIV, CKCU_POS_ADC1DIV);
00589   CKCU_Clk->ADC1_Freq = (div == 7) ? ((CKCU_Clk->HCLK_Freq) / 3) : ((CKCU_Clk->HCLK_Freq) >> div);
00590   #endif
00591   #endif
00592   #endif
00593 }
00594 
00595 #if (!LIBCFG_NO_PLL)
00596 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00597  * @brief Return the frequency of the PLL.
00598  * @retval PLL Frequency
00599  ************************************************************************************************************/
00600 u32 CKCU_GetPLLFrequency(void)
00601 {
00602   u32 pllNO, pllNF, ClockSrc;
00603   u32 CKCU_BB_PLLSRC = CKCU_BF_READ(HT_CKCU->GCFGR, CKCU_MASK_PLLSRC, CKCU_POS_PLLSRC);
00604   u32 CKCU_BB_PLLBYPASS = CKCU_BF_READ(HT_CKCU->PLLCR, CKCU_MASK_PLLBYPASS, CKCU_POS_PLLBYPASS);
00605   u32 CKCU_BB_PLLEN = CKCU_BF_READ(HT_CKCU->GCCR, CKCU_MASK_PLLEN, CKCU_POS_PLLEN);
00606   /* Get PLL frequency                                                                                      */
00607   if (CKCU_BB_PLLEN == DISABLE)
00608   {
00609     return 0;
00610   }
00611 
00612   ClockSrc = (CKCU_BB_PLLSRC == CKCU_PLLSRC_HSE) ? HSE_VALUE : HSI_VALUE;
00613 
00614   #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_PLLSRCDIV)
00615   {
00616      u32 PllSourceClockDiv = (HT_CKCU->PLLCFGR >> 28) & 1UL;
00617      ClockSrc = ClockSrc >> PllSourceClockDiv;
00618   }
00619   #endif
00620 
00621   if (CKCU_BB_PLLBYPASS == ENABLE)
00622   {
00623     return ClockSrc;
00624   }
00625 
00626   pllNF = CKCU_BF_READ(HT_CKCU->PLLCFGR, CKCU_MASK_PFBD, CKCU_POS_PFBD);
00627   if (pllNF == 0)
00628     pllNF = 16;
00629 
00630   pllNO = CKCU_BF_READ(HT_CKCU->PLLCFGR, CKCU_MASK_POTD, CKCU_POS_POTD);
00631 
00632   return ((ClockSrc * pllNF) >> pllNO);
00633 }
00634 #endif
00635 
00636 #if (!LIBCFG_CKCU_NO_APB_PRESCALER)
00637 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00638  * @brief Configure the APB peripheral prescaler.
00639  * @param Perip: specify the APB peripheral.
00640  *        This parameter can be:
00641  *        @arg CKCU_PCLK_I2C0, CKCU_PCLK_I2C1, CKCU_PCLK_I2C2,
00642  *             CKCU_PCLK_SPI0, CKCU_PCLK_SPI1,
00643  *             CKCU_PCLK_CAN0,
00644  *             CKCU_PCLK_BFTM0, CKCU_PCLK_BFTM1,
00645  *             CKCU_PCLK_MCTM0,
00646  *             CKCU_PCLK_GPTM0, CKCU_PCLK_GPTM1,
00647  *             CKCU_PCLK_USART0, CKCU_PCLK_USART1,
00648  *             CKCU_PCLK_UART0, CKCU_PCLK_UART1, CKCU_PCLK_UART2, CKCU_PCLK_UART3
00649  *             CKCU_PCLK_AFIO, CKCU_PCLK_EXTI, CKCU_PCLK_ADC, CKCU_PCLK_CMP, CKCU_PCLK_OPA
00650  *             CKCU_PCLK_WDTR, CKCU_PCLK_BKPR,
00651  *             CKCU_PCLK_SCI0, CKCU_PCLK_SCI1,
00652  *             CKCU_PCLK_I2S,
00653  *             CKCU_PCLK_SCTM0, CKCU_PCLK_SCTM1, CKCU_PCLK_SCTM2, CKCU_PCLK_SCTM3
00654  *             CKCU_PCLK_PWM0, CKCU_PCLK_PWM1
00655  *             CKCU_PCLK_AFE, CKCU_PCLK_DAC0, CKCU_PCLK_DAC1, CKCU_PCLK_MIDI
00656  *             CKCU_PCLK_LEDC, CKCU_PCLK_TKEY
00657  * @param PCLKPrescaler: specify the value of prescaler.
00658  *        This parameter can be:
00659  *        @arg CKCU_APBCLKPRE_DIV1:  specific peripheral clock = PCLK / 1  (inapplicable to BKPRCLK)
00660  *        @arg CKCU_APBCLKPRE_DIV2:  specific peripheral clock = PCLK / 2  (inapplicable to BKPRCLK)
00661  *        @arg CKCU_APBCLKPRE_DIV4:  specific peripheral clock = PCLK / 4
00662  *        @arg CKCU_APBCLKPRE_DIV8:  specific peripheral clock = PCLK / 8
00663  *        @arg CKCU_APBCLKPRE_DIV16: specific peripheral clock = PCLK / 16 (BKPRCLK only)
00664  *        @arg CKCU_APBCLKPRE_DIV32: specific peripheral clock = PCLK / 32 (BKPRCLK only)
00665  * @retval None
00666  ************************************************************************************************************/
00667 void CKCU_SetPeripPrescaler(CKCU_PeripPrescaler_TypeDef Perip, CKCU_APBCLKPRE_TypeDef PCLKPrescaler)
00668 {
00669   u32 *PCSR = (u32 *)((&HT_CKCU->APBPCSR0) + (Perip >> CKCU_APBPCSR_OFFSET));
00670   u32 Prescaler = PCLKPrescaler;
00671   if (Perip == CKCU_PCLK_BKPR)
00672   {
00673     Prescaler -= 2;
00674   }
00675   Perip &= 0x0000001F;
00676   CKCU_BF_WRITE(*PCSR, (3UL << Perip), Perip, Prescaler);
00677 }
00678 #endif
00679 
00680 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00681  * @brief Return the operating frequency of the specific APB peripheral.
00682  * @param Perip: specify the APB peripheral.
00683  *        This parameter can be:
00684  *        @arg CKCU_PCLK_I2C0, CKCU_PCLK_I2C1, CKCU_PCLK_I2C2,
00685  *             CKCU_PCLK_SPI0, CKCU_PCLK_SPI1,
00686  *             CKCU_PCLK_CAN0,
00687  *             CKCU_PCLK_BFTM0, CKCU_PCLK_BFTM1,
00688  *             CKCU_PCLK_MCTM0,
00689  *             CKCU_PCLK_GPTM0, CKCU_PCLK_GPTM1,
00690  *             CKCU_PCLK_USART0, CKCU_PCLK_USART1,
00691  *             CKCU_PCLK_UART0, CKCU_PCLK_UART1, CKCU_PCLK_UART2, CKCU_PCLK_UART3
00692  *             CKCU_PCLK_AFIO, CKCU_PCLK_EXTI, CKCU_PCLK_ADC0, CKCU_PCLK_ADC1, CKCU_PCLK_CMP, CKCU_PCLK_OPA
00693  *             CKCU_PCLK_WDTR, CKCU_PCLK_BKPR,
00694  *             CKCU_PCLK_SCI0, CKCU_PCLK_SCI1,
00695  *             CKCU_PCLK_I2S,
00696  *             CKCU_PCLK_PWM0, CKCU_PCLK_PWM1
00697  *             CKCU_PCLK_AFE, CKCU_PCLK_DAC0, CKCU_PCLK_DAC1, CKCU_PCLK_MIDI
00698  *             CKCU_PCLK_LEDC, CKCU_PCLK_TKEY 
00699  * @retval Frequency in Hz
00700  ************************************************************************************************************/
00701 u32 CKCU_GetPeripFrequency(CKCU_PeripPrescaler_TypeDef Perip)
00702 {
00703   CKCU_ClocksTypeDef Clock;
00704   u32 PCLKPrescaler = 0;
00705   #if (!LIBCFG_CKCU_NO_APB_PRESCALER)
00706   u32 *PCSR = (u32 *)(&HT_CKCU->APBPCSR0 + (Perip >> CKCU_APBPCSR_OFFSET));
00707 
00708   if (Perip == CKCU_PCLK_BKPR)
00709   {
00710     PCLKPrescaler = 2;
00711   }
00712 
00713   Perip &= 0x0000001F;
00714   PCLKPrescaler += CKCU_BF_READ(*PCSR, (3UL << Perip), Perip);
00715 
00716   #endif
00717   CKCU_GetClocksFrequency(&Clock);
00718   return (Clock.HCLK_Freq >> (PCLKPrescaler));
00719 }
00720 
00721 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00722  * @brief Enable or Disable the HSE Clock Monitor function.
00723  * @param Cmd: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00724  * @retval None
00725  ************************************************************************************************************/
00726 void CKCU_CKMCmd(ControlStatus Cmd)
00727 {
00728   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00729   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(Cmd));
00730 
00731   CKCU_BF_WRITE(HT_CKCU->GCCR, CKCU_MASK_CKMEN, CKCU_POS_CKMEN, Cmd);
00732 }
00733 
00734 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00735  * @brief Enable or Disable the power saving wakeup RC clock.
00736  * @param Cmd: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00737  * @retval None
00738  ************************************************************************************************************/
00739 void CKCU_PSRCWKUPCmd(ControlStatus Cmd)
00740 {
00741   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00742   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(Cmd));
00743 
00744   CKCU_BF_WRITE(HT_CKCU->GCCR, CKCU_MASK_PSRCEN, CKCU_POS_PSRCEN, Cmd);
00745 }
00746 
00747 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00748  * @brief Select the output clock source through the CKOUT pin.
00749  * @param CKOUTInit: pointer to CKCU_CKOUTInitTypeDef structure.
00750  * @retval None
00751  ************************************************************************************************************/
00752 void CKCU_CKOUTConfig(CKCU_CKOUTInitTypeDef *CKOUTInit)
00753 {
00754   CKCU_BF_WRITE(HT_CKCU->GCFGR, CKCU_MASK_CKOUTSRC, CKCU_POS_CKOUTSRC, CKOUTInit->CKOUTSRC);
00755 }
00756 
00757 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00758  * @brief Check whether the specific CKCU interrupt has occurred or not.
00759  * @param CKCU_INT: specify the CKCU interrupt source.
00760  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00761  *     @arg CKCU_INT_CKS: HSE clock failure interrupt flag (NMI)
00762  * @retval SET or RESET
00763  ************************************************************************************************************/
00764 FlagStatus CKCU_GetIntStatus(u32 CKCU_INT)
00765 {
00766   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00767   Assert_Param(IS_CKCU_INT_FLAG(CKCU_INT));
00768 
00769   if (HT_CKCU->GCIR & CKCU_INT)
00770   {
00771     return SET;
00772   }
00773   else
00774   {
00775     return RESET;
00776   }
00777 }
00778 
00779 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00780  * @brief Clear the CKCU interrupt flag.
00781  * @param CKCU_INT: specify the CKCU interrupt flag to clear.
00782  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00783  *     @arg CKCU_INT_CKS       : HSE clock failure interrupt flag (NMI)
00784  * @retval None
00785  ************************************************************************************************************/
00786 void CKCU_ClearIntFlag(u32 CKCU_INT)
00787 {
00788   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00789   Assert_Param(IS_CKCU_INT_FLAG(CKCU_INT));
00790 
00791   HT_CKCU->GCIR |= CKCU_INT;
00792 }
00793 
00794 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00795  * @brief Enable or Disable the specific CKCU interrupts.
00796  * @param CKCU_INT: specify the CKCU interrupt source which is enabled or disabled.
00797  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00798  *     @arg CKCU_INT_CKSIE       : HSE clock failure interrupt (NMI)
00799  * @param Cmd: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00800  * @retval None
00801  ************************************************************************************************************/
00802 void CKCU_IntConfig(u32 CKCU_INT, ControlStatus Cmd)
00803 {
00804   u32 tmp1 = HT_CKCU->GCIR;
00805 
00806   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00807   Assert_Param(IS_CKCU_INT(CKCU_INT));
00808   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(Cmd));
00809 
00810   if (Cmd != DISABLE)
00811   {
00812     tmp1 |= CKCU_INT;
00813   }
00814   else
00815   {
00816     tmp1 &= ~CKCU_INT;
00817   }
00818 
00819   /* Note: CKCU interrupt flags will be cleared by writing "1"                                              */
00820   tmp1 &= ~0x00000001;
00821   HT_CKCU->GCIR = tmp1;
00822 }
00823 
00824 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00825  * @brief Enable or Disable the AHB peripheral clock during SLEEP mode.
00826  * @param CKCU_CLK: specify the clock which is enabled or disabled.
00827  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00828  *     @arg CKCU_AHBEN_SLEEP_FMC, CKCU_AHBEN_SLEEP_SRAM, CKCU_AHBEN_SLEEP_BM, CKCU_AHBEN_SLEEP_APB0,
00829  * @param Cmd: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00830  * @retval None
00831  ************************************************************************************************************/
00832 void CKCU_SleepClockConfig(u32 CKCU_CLK, ControlStatus Cmd)
00833 {
00834   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00835   Assert_Param(IS_CKCU_SLEEP_AHB(CKCU_CLK));
00836   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(Cmd));
00837 
00838   if (Cmd != DISABLE)
00839   {
00840     HT_CKCU->AHBCCR |= CKCU_CLK;
00841   }
00842   else
00843   {
00844     HT_CKCU->AHBCCR &= ~CKCU_CLK;
00845   }
00846 }
00847 
00848 #if (!LIBCFG_NO_PLL)
00849 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00850  * @brief Check if PLL clock used by the specific target source or not.
00851  * @param Target: specify the target clock.
00852  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00853  *     @arg CKCU_PLLST_SYSCK : Is PLL used by system clock
00854  *     @arg CKCU_PLLST_USB   : Is PLL used by USB
00855  *     @arg CKCU_PLLST_REFCK : Is PLL used by CK_REF
00856  * @retval TRUE or FALSE
00857  ************************************************************************************************************/
00858 bool CKCU_IS_PLL_USED(CKCU_PLLST_TypeDef Target)
00859 {
00860   if ((HT_CKCU->CKST >> CKCU_POS_PLLST) & (u32)Target)
00861   {
00862     return TRUE;
00863   }
00864   else
00865   {
00866     return FALSE;
00867   }
00868 }
00869 #endif
00870 
00871 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00872  * @brief Check HSI clock used by the specific target source or not.
00873  * @param Target: specify the target clock.
00874  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00875  *     @arg CKCU_HSIST_SYSCK : Is HSI used by system clock
00876  *     @arg CKCU_HSIST_PLL   : Is HSI used by PLL
00877  *     @arg CKCU_HSIST_CKM   : Is HSI used by clock monitor
00878  * @retval TRUE or FALSE
00879  ************************************************************************************************************/
00880 bool CKCU_IS_HSI_USED(CKCU_HSIST_TypeDef Target)
00881 {
00882   if ((HT_CKCU->CKST >> CKCU_POS_HSIST) & (u32)Target)
00883   {
00884     return TRUE;
00885   }
00886   else
00887   {
00888     return FALSE;
00889   }
00890 }
00891 
00892 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00893  * @brief Check HSE clock used by the specific target source or not.
00894  * @param Target: specify the target clock.
00895  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00896  *     @arg CKCU_HSEST_SYSCK : Is HSE used by system clock
00897  *     @arg CKCU_HSEST_PLL   : Is HSE used by PLL
00898  * @retval TRUE or FALSE
00899  ************************************************************************************************************/
00900 bool CKCU_IS_HSE_USED(CKCU_HSEST_TypeDef Target)
00901 {
00902   if ((HT_CKCU->CKST >> CKCU_POS_HSEST) & (u32)Target)
00903   {
00904     return TRUE;
00905   }
00906   else
00907   {
00908     return FALSE;
00909   }
00910 }
00911 
00912 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00913  * @brief Enable or Disable the specific debug function.
00914  * @param CKCU_DBGx: specify the debug functions to be enabled or disabled.
00915  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00916  *     @arg CKCU_DBG_SLEEP, CKCU_DBG_DEEPSLEEP1, CKCU_DBG_DEEPSLEEP2, CKCU_DBG_POWERDOWN,
00917  *          CKCU_DBG_MCTM0_HALT,
00918  *          CKCU_DBG_GPTM0_HALT, CKCU_DBG_GPTM1_HALT,
00919  *          CKCU_DBG_SCTM0_HALT, CKCU_DBG_SCTM1_HALT, CKCU_DBG_SCTM2_HALT, CKCU_DBG_SCTM3_HALT,
00920  *          CKCU_DBG_BFTM0_HALT, CKCU_DBG_BFTM1_HALT,
00921  *          CKCU_DBG_USART0_HALT, CKCU_DBG_USART1_HALT,
00922  *          CKCU_DBG_UART0_HALT, CKCU_DBG_UART1_HALT, CKCU_DBG_UART2_HALT, CKCU_DBG_UART3_HALT,
00923  *          CKCU_DBG_SPI0_HALT, CKCU_DBG_SPI1_HALT, CKCU_DBG_QSPI_HALT,
00924  *          CKCU_DBG_I2C0_HALT, CKCU_DBG_I2C1_HALT, CKCU_DBG_I2C2_HALT,
00925  *          CKCU_DBG_CAN0_HALT
00926  *          CKCU_DBG_SCI0_HALT, CKCU_DBG_SCI1_HALT,
00927  *          CKCU_DBG_WDT_HALT,
00928  *          CKCU_DBG_PWM0_HALT, CKCU_DBG_PWM1_HALT, CKCU_DBG_PWM2_HALT,
00929  * @param Cmd: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00930  * @retval None
00931  ************************************************************************************************************/
00932 void CKCU_MCUDBGConfig(u32 CKCU_DBGx, ControlStatus Cmd)
00933 {
00934   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00935   Assert_Param(IS_CKCU_DBG(CKCU_DBGx));
00936   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(Cmd));
00937 
00938   if (Cmd != DISABLE)
00939   {
00940     HT_CKCU->MCUDBGCR |= CKCU_DBGx;
00941   }
00942   else
00943   {
00944     HT_CKCU->MCUDBGCR &= ~CKCU_DBGx;
00945   }
00946 }
00947 
00948 #if (!LIBCFG_CKCU_NO_LPCR)
00949 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00950  * @brief Enable or Disable the Backup domain isolation control.
00951  * @param Cmd: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00952  * @retval None
00953  ************************************************************************************************************/
00954 void CKCU_BKISOCmd(ControlStatus Cmd)
00955 {
00956   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00957   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(Cmd));
00958 
00959   /* DISABLE: Backup domain is isolated                                                                     */
00960   CKCU_BF_WRITE(HT_CKCU->LPCR, CKCU_MASK_BKISO, CKCU_POS_BKISO, !Cmd);
00961 }
00962 #endif
00963 
00964 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00965  * @brief Enable or Disable the peripheral clock.
00966  * @param Clock: specify the peripheral clock enable bits.
00967  * @param Cmd: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00968  * @retval None
00969  ************************************************************************************************************/
00970 void CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef Clock, ControlStatus Cmd)
00971 {
00972   u32 uAHBCCR;
00973   u32 uAPBCCR0;
00974   u32 uAPBCCR1;
00975 
00976   uAHBCCR  = HT_CKCU->AHBCCR;
00977   uAPBCCR0 = HT_CKCU->APBCCR0;
00978   uAPBCCR1 = HT_CKCU->APBCCR1;
00979 
00980   uAHBCCR  &= ~(Clock.Reg[0]);
00981   uAPBCCR0 &= ~(Clock.Reg[1]);
00982   uAPBCCR1 &= ~(Clock.Reg[2]);
00983 
00984   if (Cmd != DISABLE)
00985   {
00986     uAHBCCR  |= Clock.Reg[0];
00987     uAPBCCR0 |= Clock.Reg[1];
00988     uAPBCCR1 |= Clock.Reg[2];
00989   }
00990 
00991   HT_CKCU->AHBCCR  = uAHBCCR;
00992   HT_CKCU->APBCCR0 = uAPBCCR0;
00993   HT_CKCU->APBCCR1 = uAPBCCR1;
00994 }
00995 
00996 #if (((LIBCFG_LSE) || (LIBCFG_USBD)) && (!LIBCFG_CKCU_NO_AUTO_TRIM))
00997 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00998  * @brief Configure the reference clock of HSI auto-trim function.
00999  * @param CLKSRC: specify the clock source.
01000  *        This parameter can be:
01001  *        @arg CKCU_ATC_LSE: LSE is selected as reference clock
01002  *        @arg CKCU_ATC_USB: USB is selected as reference clock
01003  *        @arg CKCU_ATC_CKIN: External pin (CKIN) is selected as reference clock
01004  * @retval None
01005  ************************************************************************************************************/
01006 void CKCU_HSIAutoTrimClkConfig(CKCU_ATC_TypeDef CLKSRC)
01007 {
01008   CKCU_BF_WRITE(HT_CKCU->HSICR, CKCU_MASK_REFCLKSEL, CKCU_POS_REFCLKSEL, CLKSRC);
01009 }
01010 
01011 #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_ATM_V01)
01012 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
01013  * @brief Initialize the ATC according to the specified parameters in the ATC_InitStruct.
01014  * @param ATC_InitStruct: pointer to a CKCU_ATCInitTypeDef structure.
01015  * @retval None
01016  ************************************************************************************************************/
01017 void CKCU_ATCInit(CKCU_ATCInitTypeDef* ATC_InitStruct)
01018 {
01019   HT_CKCU->HSICR &= 0xFFFFFFF3;
01020   HT_CKCU->HSICR |= (u32)ATC_InitStruct->SearchAlgorithm | (u32)ATC_InitStruct->FrqTolerance;
01021 }
01022 #endif
01023 
01024 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
01025  * @brief Enable or Disable the HSI auto-trim function.
01026  * @param Cmd: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
01027  * @retval None
01028  ************************************************************************************************************/
01029 void CKCU_HSIAutoTrimCmd(ControlStatus Cmd)
01030 {
01031   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
01032   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(Cmd));
01033 
01034   CKCU_BF_WRITE(HT_CKCU->HSICR, CKCU_MASK_TRIMEN, CKCU_POS_TRIMEN, Cmd);
01035   CKCU_BF_WRITE(HT_CKCU->HSICR, CKCU_MASK_ATCEN, CKCU_POS_ATCEN, Cmd);
01036 }
01037 
01038 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
01039  * @brief Check Auto Trim is ready or not.
01040  * @retval TRUE or FALSE
01041  ************************************************************************************************************/
01042 bool CKCU_HSIAutoTrimIsReady(void)
01043 {
01044 #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_AUTO_TRIM_LEGACY)
01045   u32 lower_bound, upper_bound, i;
01046   static u32 ATCR = 0;
01047 
01048   if ((HT_CKCU->HSICR & (3ul << 5)) == 0)
01049   {
01050     lower_bound = 7812 - 19;
01051     upper_bound = 7812 + 19;
01052   }
01053   else
01054   {
01055     lower_bound = 8000 - 20;
01056     upper_bound = 8000 + 20;
01057   }
01058 
01059   SystemCoreClockUpdate();
01060   for (i = SystemCoreClock / 8000; i > 0; i--){};
01061   ATCR += HT_CKCU->HSIATCR;
01062   ATCR /= 2;
01063 
01064   if ((ATCR >= lower_bound) && (ATCR <= upper_bound))
01065   {
01066     ATCR = 0;
01067     return TRUE;
01068   }
01069   else
01070   {
01071     return FALSE;
01072   }
01073 
01074 #else
01075   return (HT_CKCU->HSICR & 0x80) ? TRUE : FALSE;
01076 #endif
01077 }
01078 #endif
01079 
01080 #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_HSIRDYCR)
01081 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
01082  * @brief Set HSI Ready Counter Value.
01083  * @param Value: 0x0~0x1F.
01084  * @retval None
01085  ************************************************************************************************************/
01086 void CKCU_Set_HSIReadyCounter(u8 Value)
01087 {
01088   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
01089   Assert_Param(IS_COUNTER_VALUE(Value));
01090 
01091   HT_CKCU->HSIRDYCR = ((HT_CKCU->HSIRDYCR) & (~(0x1F))) | Value;
01092 }
01093 #endif
01094 /**
01095   * @}
01096   */
01097 
01098 
01099 /**
01100   * @}
01101   */
01102 
01103 /**
01104   * @}
01105   */

For complete information of HT32 Series 32-bit Microcontrollers platform visit Holtek Website
